channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: When the game has set itself apart, operating at a more exalted level than the rest of the community, who can blame players for seeing themselves as exceptions?
item.title: How can the NRL slam wayward stars? They are its ultimate ambassadors

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: AFL chief executive Gillon McLachlan has sent out a firm warning to the league’s players to respect strict quarantine rules when the 2020 season resumed.
item.title: Players have a responsibility: McLachlan won't negotiate on health protocols

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: In the backstreets of Sydney's inner-west lies a molecular diagnostics company which is producing COVID-19 testing kits for use in hospitals and private labs across Australia and Europe.
item.title: 'It is ultimately saving lives': Businesses respond to COVID-19 medical supplies plea

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW begins first day of partially relaxed social distancing rules, global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.2 million, Australia's death toll stands at 93

item.description: It will be the first lunar lander since the last Apollo moon mission in 1972.
item.title: NASA picks designs for spacecraft to take astronauts back to the moon

item.description: For 39 years, David Astle has been the master of The Sydney Morning Herald's crosswords. To launch our new digital puzzles, he gives us a glimpse into how he manages to both torture and delight readers.
item.title: Tips and memory trips from crossword legend David Astle

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: national death toll rises as cabinet meets and state's restrictions set to ease

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Auckland-based NRL side have been given the official green light to travel to Australia as soon as this Sunday.
item.title: National cabinet gives Warriors green light to fly to Tamworth

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: On July 1, tolls on the Clem7, Gateway Motorway, Go Between Bridge, Legacy Way, Toowoomba Bypass and Logan Motorway are set to rise.
item.title: Calls for freeze on toll road, vehicle registration, public transport price hikes

item.description: Victorians have woken to a cold and rainy start to May, with another day of wet weather, wild wind and even snow.
item.title: Cold, wet and windy: Victoria gets an early taste of winter

item.description: These easy home workouts can ward off ill health, low mood and frailty for over-60s.
item.title: Staying fit during lockdown is even more important for seniors

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The completion marks the end to a tumultuous six months, in which both publishers waited for regulatory approval of the deal and Bauer tried to renegotiate a lower price in the coronavirus downturn.
item.title: Bauer completes $40m takeover of Seven's magazines

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews says he has bigger things to worry about than a controversial tweet by deputy Chief Health Officer Annaliese van Diemen.
item.title: Premier stands by besieged deputy chief health officer over tweet

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: A man who allegedly held up a CBD gold dealer while wearing a surgical mask has been charged with staging one of the biggest armed robberies in Victoria.
item.title: $3.9 million gold armed heist one of the biggest in Victoria's history

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Mr Barilaro's federal ambitions would set up a three-way showdown with the Liberal Party and Labor for the marginal seat.
item.title: NSW Deputy Premier John Barilaro to decide Eden-Monaro gamble over the weekend

item.description: American teenage basketball prodigy LaMelo Ball is still keen on buying the Illawarra Hawks and is just awaiting word from the NBL.
item.title: 'Ready, willing, able': LaMelo Ball waits for NBL word on Hawks purchase

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The partners of up to 40 AFL players are due to give birth during the time the AFL has proposed to put clubs inside quarantine hubs to play games.
item.title: Baby bump: Players cold on 20-week hub lock-up

item.description: Fewer COVID-19 intensive care patients in Victoria but another three cases confirmed
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: CoreLogic estimates settled sales plunged by 40 per cent in April as buyers retreated from the market and sellers stopped putting up their homes.
item.title: House prices slow as sellers and buyers desert the market

item.description: Acclaimed Australian explorer Jon Muir spent four months alone in the desert and says there are lessons to be learnt from our enforced social isolation.
item.title: Day of reckoning for brave new world

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bunbury
item.description: The "shy" best friend and long-time professional collaborator of Phoebe Waller-Bridge unveils her own TV series, inspired by an old pact.
item.title: A running joke: Vicky Jones steps out of the shadow of her best friend

item.dc:creator: John Bailey
item.description: Classical philosophy might be about as useful as cow dung.
item.title: What good is philosophy right now? A dabbler's guide to lockdown

item.description: Sick of his-and-her approaches to dressing, a growing number of young people are joining celebrities in embracing non-binary style with fun and flair.
item.title: Dressed for unisex: how celebrities are stepping up – and out – for fashion fluidity

item.description: Former plumbing apprentice Matt Leo will join the Philadelphia Eagles this season and owes it all to a chance glance at the television screen.
item.title: How Adelaide smoko eventually led to NFL leap for Leo

item.description: From the age of 16, Alathea Fitzalan Howard spent her war years with then Princess Elizabeth and her sister Margaret at Windsor Castle.
item.title: Diaries reveal life in 'lockdown' with future Queen Elizabeth

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Within the next fortnight expect big changes around Brisbane's Roma Street Station as the 12-month demolition program accelerates.
item.title: Roma Street Station's walls are tumbling down as 'new' replaces 'old'

item.dc:creator: Jane Caro
item.description: When Jane Caro's newborn daughter fell ill, a grief counsellor offered some simple advice in a hospital cafe. It was exactly what she needed to hear.
item.title: As a young mother, these words saved me. They still ring true today.

item.description: Track around heavy 9/10 and rail true for Showcase listed Gold Cup day so likely gradual trend away from the fence.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Wagga Wagga Gold Cup day on Friday

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Adam Liaw
item.description: Take a trip down memory lane – it will lead to the pub.
item.title: Adam Liaw's make it takeaway: parmigiana pasta, and slow-roasted garlic mushrooms

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: “It’s a permanent reminder of what we were able to create. Healing that land healed our relationship and that might sound corny and clichéd but it’s true.”
item.title: Perth’s biggest DIY self-isolation project? How one family went green to beat the blues

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Many people at the rally, including militia group members carrying firearms and people with pro-Trump signs, ignored social-distancing guidelines.
item.title: Armed protesters stage rally against Michigan's emergency powers

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Atlassian expects to gain further market share during the coronavirus pandemic, with companies having staff work from home and relying on collaboration tools like its workplace software.
item.title: 'Unscathed' Atlassian eyes growth in the pandemic as sales jump 33 per cent

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 1, 2020

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Share prices are set to decline when trading begins today after the ASX's best month on record last month.
item.title: Shares tumble more than 3 per cent at open

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The Queensland government is throwing $5.5 million at decking out an entire floor of its start-up precinct in the Fortitude Valley.
item.title: New AI hub to fill Queensland's talent shortage

item.description: Australia, like other Western nations, should focus on addressing the immediate challenges of coronavirus before seeking to mount an international inquiry into its origins.
item.title: Why the haste on a COVID inquiry? Australia can't afford to amplify US anti-China offensive

item.description: Sir John Bell, Regius Professor of Medicine at Oxford University, said "several hundred" Britons have now been given the experimental jab.
item.title: Oxford vaccine test results 'expected in six weeks' after experimental jabs

item.description: The local sharemarket is set to follow Wall Street's lead, where stocks lost ground overnight amid grim economic data and mixed earnings reports.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to start trading lower after a record month

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A Perth family claims they have been refused social visits to their elderly relative by a nursing home, despite repeated government calls to stop locking out visitors.
item.title: 'Despicable': Perth family's heartache after nursing home bans visits

item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency has given findings from the Russia probe into almost 300 athletes to 27 international federations and one major event organisation.
item.title: Fresh charges likely as WADA hands over Russia evidence

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: "WA excites me and it always has," King said. "It's got such a rich history of big cat sightings, and the sightings are always just so genuinely amazing, they sound believable."
item.title: On the hunt for mysterious big cats with WA's very own tiger king

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: WAtoday is keen for students from kindy to year 12 to share their thoughts and feelings about being back in the classroom, or learning remotely from home.
item.title: Calling all WA students: Have your say on schooling during COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: During the investigation, 14 staff members detailed interactions with the secretary, with some claiming psychological harm, hurt and humiliation resulting from these encounters.
item.title: WA union secretary in hot water over bullying claims and misuse of funds

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Dockers duo issued club sanctions as national cabinet decision on sport expected today

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: Day after day Anthony Bowe appears at the front fence of Newmarch House, waiting to see or hear from his 76-year-old mother Patricia Shea, who is among 59 residents and staff linked to the aged care facility with coronavirus.
item.title: Another death, infections rise at Newmarch House as families await answers

item.description: CEO Tim Cook made the announcement after releasing Apple's fiscal second-quarter results, which beat expectations. But uncertainty in the pandemic was too big to make any profit forecasts, he said.
item.title: Apple prepares to reopen stores in Australia as global sales inch higher

item.description: The timing of the announcement offered further evidence that South Korea has become a world leader in how to successfully defeat COVID-19.
item.title: No new coronavirus cases reported in South Korea
